Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 14.94 Å (cube dimension), 21.13 Å (big cage diameter), 15.62 Å (small cage diameter)

Other Information.Additional Info: RDX showed physisorption at T = 0 K but did not exhibit stable trapping configurations at T = 300 K.
TATP exhibited three stable trapping configurations both inside and on the exterior surface of IRMOF-8 at T = 300 K.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion due to steric hindrance and molecular sieving effects caused by size and shape differences

Experimental Validation.Method: Ab initio density functional theory (DFT) calculations and molecular dynamics (MD) simulations

Other Information.Additional Info: IRMOF-8 has higher hydrogen uptake than IRMOF-1 due to its NDC linkers, which provide more adsorption sites. Changes in electronic structure induced by guest molecules could be exploited for detection technologies.
